text: Inner Jellyfishes () is a Canadian short drama film, directed by Marc-Antoine Lemire and released in 2015."Des courts... de tous les genres". Fugues, November 17, 2015. The film stars Rudi Duperré as a young gay man struggling with feelings of isolation who hooks up with another man (Samuel Brassard) for sex, but finds that the encounter intensifies rather than assuaging his loneliness as he experiences a desire for a deeper emotional connection than the hookup is willing or able to offer."Les Méduses". MediaQueer. The film's screenings included the 2015 Image+Nation festival"28e édition d’Image + Nation". Le Devoir, November 26, 2015. and the 2015 San Francisco International Festival of Short Films, where it won the Vanguard Award. It was screened at BFI Flare in 2016 as part of a program of films about chemsex, with the website The Conversation praising it as one of the only films in the program that did not moralize about the practice."Chemsex: why is gay sex causing straight panic?". The Conversation, April 12, 2016. ==References== ==External links== * Category:2015 films Category:Canadian films Category:Canadian drama films Category:Canadian short films Category:Canadian LGBT-related films Category:LGBT-related drama films Category:LGBT-related short films Category:Films shot in Quebec Category:Films set in Quebec Category:2015 LGBT-related films
title: Inner Jellyfishes
